lcInstruction.p: In brief, a learning object is a “discrete reusable collection of content used to present and support a single learning objective.”

The DITA Learning and Training specialization was created with the reusable learning object, or RLO, approach to learning content in mind. This derived from work by learning content designers at Autodesk, Oracle, Cisco, and other companies. The idea is to create a collection of information objects that can be reused and repurposed, depending on how you need to deliver your learning content.
